item.title: Report X-2025020433
item.description:
Report X-2025020433

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED BY A DRIVER THAT THEY HAD A LEAKING DECLARED HAZMAT IN THEIR TRUCK. RESPONDER DONNED HIS FULL PPE AND ARRIVED ON SCENE TO FIND THE LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE FLOOR OF THE TRUCK. RESPONDER PLACED THE LEAKING HAZMAT INTO A SPILL TRAY AND CLEANED ANY SPILLAGE BEFORE PLACING THE SPILL TRAY ON HIS CART AND RETURNING TO THE PSC.

item.title: Report E-2025020055
item.description:
Report E-2025020055

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 31, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of sulfuric acid solution was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizer, absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.
